body:
+1

I've tried acd_fuse, it seems sporadically slow and weird (I blame FUSE) and there's some visibility differences between the filesystem and the web UI on Amazon which I don't know who is to blame.

One thing I would request is before doing that, if there can be encryption applied beforehand.

file | encrypt > remote

A good idea - thanks. It certainly looks possible...

As for encryption - my plan would be to put that into rclone as a encrypting local filesystem which would make it available for all remote file system types.

+1

Would be nice to see support for acd.

issue.title: Amazon CloudDrive Support

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: It would be nice if rclone could support Amazon's Cloud Drive. I haven't looked at the API much, but there [is one](https://developer.amazon.com/public/apis/experience/cloud-drive/).

body:
+1 
The ACD App for mac provided by Amazon really sucks. I would really like to have rclone support for ACD.
https://github.com/sgeb/acdcli and its backing library https://github.com/sgeb/go-acd might help.
I'm using ACD_CLI, it's pretty good! Would be great to get this integrated into rclone :-) :+1:
Yes, please integrate into rclone :+1:  I wish I knew Go so I could help out but am just beginning to learn it.

Support for Amazon Cloud Drive is now live in v1.20.  It should be pretty stable, but if you find any issues with it then you know what to do!

Thanks

Nick
Any chance of rclone latest ver being compiled for windows? Struggling with compiling on my end.
@OldGlory747 Find it on the downloads page http://rclone.org/downloads/ :-)

That was my mistake :) Was grabbing it from here:
http://www.craig-wood.com/nick/pub/rclone/windows/
Thanks much!!
@OldGlory747 Gosh, those are ancient builds - I didn't even know they were there!  Did you see a link to them somewhere I need to change?

Haha, nope, just good old fashion Google.
On Oct 7, 2015 1:51 PM, "Nick Craig-Wood" notifications@github.com wrote:

> @OldGlory747 https://github.com/OldGlory747 Gosh, those are ancient
> builds - I didn't even know they were there! Did you see a link to them
> somewhere I need to change?
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/45#issuecomment-146324180.
@OldGlory747 Ah OK!  I've deleted those, so hopefully they will disappear from the google search soon. Thanks for letting me know.
